Job Title: Automation Engineer (Injection Molding)

Location: Fort Worth, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
As an Automation Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in advancing our production processes through the design, implementation, and maintenance of automated systems. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to optimize efficiency, reliability, and safety in our manufacturing operations, with a specific focus on plastic injection molding technology for EV components.
Responsibilities
1.Design and Development:Conceptualize, design, and develop automated systems tailored to enhance the efficiency and productivity of plastic injection molding processes.
2.Programming and Integration:Program and integrate automation technologies, including robotic systems, PLCs (Programmable Logic Controllers), HMIs (Human-Machine Interfaces), and other control systems to streamline manufacturing operations.
3.System Optimization:Continuously analyze and optimize automated systems to improve throughput, minimize downtime, and enhance product quality.
4.Troubleshooting and Maintenance:Conduct routine maintenance activities and troubleshoot issues to ensure the uninterrupted operation of automated equipment. Develop preventive maintenance schedules and implement corrective actions as necessary.
5.Collaboration and Support:Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including production, engineering, and maintenance, to identify automation needs, address challenges, and implement solutions that align with business objectives. Communicate with automation team in headquarter to understand the design concept, specification and provide feedback loop.
6.Compliance and Safety:Ensure compliance with industry standards, regulations, and safety protocols in the design and operation of automated systems. Conduct risk assessments and implement appropriate safety measures to mitigate potential hazards.
7.Documentation and Reporting:Maintain accurate documentation of automation designs,configurations, and maintenance activities. Generate reports on system performance, efficiencyimprovements, and cost savings initiatives.

Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering, Electrical Engineering, Automation Engineering, or related field.Proven experience in designing, programming, and implementing automation solutions in a manufacturing environment, preferably within the automotive industry.Prior experience designing automation for plastic injection molding componentsProficiency in programming languages such as PLC ladder logic, C/C++, Python, or similar languages. Strong understanding of robotics, motion control systems, sensors, and actuators. Familiarity with CAD software for system design and simulation (e.g., UG, CATIA, SolidWorks, AutoCAD).Strong problem-solving skills. Be able to use tools, such as 5 why, fish bone, DOE, to systematically resolve machine and process issuesEffective communication skills with the ability to collaborate and communicate effectively across all levels of the organization.English- Fluent, Mandarin fluent is preferred

Experience Level (if available): None
